message: According to the IDF spokesperson, an IDF officer and soldier were moderately injured early this morning as a result of a fall (of a Hezbollah UAV -AA) near Ayelat HaShachar.
event_breakdown:
* An IDF officer and soldier were moderately injured early this morning as a result of a fall (of a Hezbollah UAV -AA) near Ayelat HaShachar.
* IDF soldiers and Israeli security forces arrested four Palestinians on Tuesday night who were in possession of drugs and knives in Hebron, the Palestinian Authority's news agency Wafa reported. The suspects were arrested near Hebron's Old City.
* One man was found dead from gunfire in the Israeli-Arab city of Tira on Tuesday evening, Arab media outlets reported. The circumstances surrounding the death remained under investigation as of Wednesday afternoon.
* An Israeli was lightly wounded in a stabbing on Wednesday morning in Jerusalem's Old City, police and paramedics said. The 27-year-old was stabbed in the neck with a screwdriver by a Palestinian attacker, police said.
* A Palestinian teen was shot and moderately wounded while throwing rocks at Israeli security forces on Tuesday afternoon, Palestinian media reported. The incident occurred in Palestinian-controlled Hebron.
* Israeli forces on Tuesday detained two Palestinians for questioning while serving administrative detention orders in the northern West Bank city of Tulkarm, Palestinian Authority news agency Wafa reported.
* Israeli forces demolished several Bedouin structures in two separate incidents in the Negev on Wednesday morning, Palestinian media reported.
* Israeli forces conducted an overnight detention raid in the southern West Bank city of Bethlehem early Tuesday morning to arrest wanted Palestinians, advocacy group the International Christian Coalition reported.

message:
The Lebanese Ministry of Health reports two deaths as a result of an Israeli UAV attack about an hour ago in Meiss el-Jabal in southern Lebanon.

According to Lebanese sources, one of the dead is a member of the rescue forces of the Shia Amal movement - Muhammad Fouzi Hammadi (pictured).
Apparently, the second is his colleague.
event_breakdown: UAV attack in Lebanon, Meiss el-Jabal

message:
How wretched is the military arm of Hamas and how desperate is it to accept responsibility for terrorist attacks?

Even after the Islamic Jihad revealed a photographed testament of Jamal Abu Haniyeh and Ali Khalil 👆 according to which they are both Islamic Jihad operatives (those who murdered Amnon Mokhtar on June 22 in Qalqiliya), the military wing of Hamas publishes a poster stating that the two are Hamas operatives.
event_breakdown: The military arm of Hamas, known as the Izz al-Din al-Qassam Brigades, has published a poster taking responsibility for the two Islamic Jihad operatives who murdered Amnon Mokhtar on June 22 in Qalqiliya. Hamas has been under intense international pressure to renounce terrorism and recognize Israel’s right to exist, but the group has refused to do so. The Israeli military recently carried out airstrikes in Gaza in retaliation to rocket attacks launched by Palestinians. The security situation remains tense in the region, with both sides accusing each other of violating ceasefires.

message:
Khalil al-Hayya, a member of the political bureau of Hamas and deputy of Yahya Sinwar. The leadership is united and within days we will finish the consultations to choose a new leader for the movement (in place of Haniyeh-AA).

##
Al-Hayya's statement comes amid reports of disputes regarding the selection of Haniyeh's replacement, with the most prominent candidates being himself and Khaled Mashal.
event_breakdown: Target event not found.

message:
On May 22, the IDF conducted an extensive operation in Jenin.
During the operation, IDF forces arrested Wafaa Jarrar, the wife of Abd al-Jabbar Jarrar, a senior member of Hamas in Jenin who is imprisoned in Israel.

Unfortunately for her, the terrorists in Jenin set off an explosive device against the Israeli jeep she was staying in after she was arrested. As a result, her legs were amputated and she was transferred to the hospital for treatment (the IDF released her from detention because of this).

Today the Palestinians reported that Jarrar died of her wounds...
So that in fact a senior woman in Hamas was killed by an explosion by terrorists in Jenin...

##
Their sword shall enter into their own heart...
event_breakdown: IDF operation in Jenin, Wafaa Jarrar killed by explosives set by terrorists in Jenin

IDF activity in Jenin

message:
Following on from the report here 👆👆 yesterday evening:

IDF spokesperson: Yesterday (Sunday), with the direction of IDF intelligence, the IAF eliminated Abed Al-Zeriei, a terrorist operative in the Manufacturing Department of Hamas' Military Wing, who also served as Hamas' Minister of Economy in the Gaza Strip.
 
The Manufacturing Department operates to increase Hamas' weapons capabilities, including by exchanging information with other terrorist organizations across the Middle East. 
 
Al-Zeriei had a significant role in directing Hamas' efforts to seize control of humanitarian aid entering the Gaza Strip and in managing Hamas-controlled markets. Furthermore, he was responsible for the distribution of fuel, gas, and funds for terrorist purposes.
event_breakdown: IDF eliminated an operative in the manufacturing department of Hamas' military wing, Abed Al-Zeriei, on Sunday evening. He also served as a minister in the Gaza Strip.

message:
Joint IDF and ISA announcement:

During the strike on Hamas command and control centers in Gaza City; the IDF and ISA eliminated the terrorist Jaber Aziz, Commander of Hamas' Al-Furqan Battalion

Yesterday (Sunday), based on IDF and ISA intelligence, the IDF struck Hamas terrorists who operated in a Hamas command and control center that was embedded within the "Hassan Salame" and "Nasser" schools in Gaza City.
According to IDF and ISA intelligence, during the strike in the area of the "Hassan Salame" school, the terrorist Jaber Aziz, Commander of Hamas' Al-Furqan Battalion was eliminated along with additional terrorists.

Aziz has been the Commander of Hamas' Al-Furqan Battalion since 2020. He was previously the Deputy Commander of the Al-Furqan Battalion, Deputy Commander of the Zaytun Battalion, and the Commander of the Zaytun Battalion.

Aziz took a significant part in the planning of the October 7th massacre and led the preparations and training of the Al-Furqan Battalion. He also participated in the infiltration into communities near the Gaza Strip on October 7th.

Throughout the war, he was responsible for directing and promoting numerous terror attacks against the IDF and the State of Israel. Aziz was a key operative in the war management of Hamas' Gaza Brigade. His elimination significantly degrades the capabilities of the Hamas terrorist organization.
event_breakdown: IDF and ISA eliminated the terrorist Jaber Aziz, Commander of Hamas' Al-Furqan Battalion in a news push that reports an event that is happening in the current time frame and belongs to to the category security.

message:
I would like to point out that following the instruction of the IDF spokesman yesterday afternoon to evacuate the neighborhoods of south Khan Yunis and north Rafah 👆 no photos and videos of civilians evacuating from the area were seen on social media, unlike usual after evacuation instructions.

##
In my opinion, this is due to the fact that the area is relatively sparsely populated and because there was no report of shooting and fire from the IDF which usually "speeds up" the evacuation.

message:
Sergei Shoigu, the head of the Russian Security Council, has concluded his visit to Iran after meeting with the Iranian president and is now on his way to Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan.

Iranian sources claim that his intention is to warn Azerbaijan against taking any actions in favor of Israel concerning Iran.
event_breakdown:
Shoigu's trip comes amid heightened tensions between Russia and Western countries over Ukraine, and as Iran is in talks with world powers to revive a nuclear deal.
The Iranian president's office called the visit "positive and constructive" and said it emphasized the two countries' "shared views on regional issues".
President Raisi told Shoigu that Iran was ready to broaden cooperation with Russia in regional security and stability.
The head of the Iranian Armed Forces Headquarters issued a warning to Azerbaijan on Saturday.
A conflict has erupted between Armenia and Azerbaijan over Nagorno-Karabakh, a mountainous region and internationally recognized as part of Azerbaijan but populated and controlled by ethnic Armenians.
He said the Islamic republic had "limitations" on its ability to respond to security threats, adding, " in these cases, we will act to hold accountable those directly responsible for these actions and their supporters in international bodies, and will pursue measures on judicial, political and security levels."
Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said he would hold Israel and the countries supporting it accountable for any and all actions harming Iranian security.

event_breakdown:
Lebanese Hezbollah member Ali Jawed (nickname: Karbala!), born in 1987, was killed by an Israeli drone strike while riding his motorcycle near Jibchit in Lebanon on August 28, 2020. He was a commander in Hezbollah's Radwan Force.

This was the fourth Hezbollah member killed by Israeli strikes in Lebanon this month.
